pr_body:
## Description
Heat currently supports 1D convolution with only distributed signals. This PR add support for performing 1D convolution with fully distributed signal as well as the kernel.

### Changes done:
- Support added for 1D convolution with all existing modes.
- Pads uneven local weights with zero when input kernel is unevenly distributed.
- Used `bcast` to send kernel/ weights among the processes.
- Applying convolution on local signal and weights.
- Slicing and adding up the calculated signal_filtered 
- Modified and added documentation and correctness tests.

### Approach of solving:
Whenever the kernel `v`, is distributed, we must find the convolution of all distributed kernels with signals and store it in a DNDarray. Later, compute the filtered signal by slicing a chunk of the size of our output's (convolution) shape from each row of the DNDarray and adding them along its column to get our result.

Added the diagram of the same for better understanding [here](https://jamboard.google.com/d/1e1n-Py7drEk1JwmwH7_WKQaeL-gV6DDfz9G6UluJ8cE/edit?usp=sharing)

<!-- Remove this line for GPU Cluster tests. It will need an approval. --->
skip ci
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 916536759, 'comment_body': 'You can condense this by `if v.is_distributed():`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 8, 7, 25, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 916594003, 'comment_body': 'Vectorize?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 8, 8, 37, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 920948670, 'comment_body': 'Now we can deal with distributed kernels, so we can improve consistency with numpy by swapping `a` and `v` if `a` is smaller than `v`, correct?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 9, 26, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 920954347, 'comment_body': 'We should swap `a` and `v` when `a` is smaller than `v` (see above)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 9, 32, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 920956869, 'comment_body': 'specify `device`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 9, 34, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 920970352, 'comment_body': "I haven't had time to think this through, but maybe you can test this idea and we talk about it tomorrow: could these 2 loops be replaced by 1 loop using Bcast communication? see https://mpitutorial.com/tutorials/mpi-broadcast-and-collective-communication/", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 9, 49, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 921861297, 'comment_body': 'yes, will make the required changes.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 6, 43, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922193490, 'comment_body': "yes, did it above. But when, ```python a = ht.array([1, 1, 1, 1], split=0) v = ht.array([1, 1, 1]) ``` we should raise this error, because it shouldn't work when no. of processes is more than 2. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 13, 58, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1027324698, 'comment_body': 'This does not work. The halo size cannot depend on the local size of the first process, as this is arbitrary, e.g. one can set the local filter size at process 1 to zero with redistribute_, resulting in halo_size=0, regardless of the actual filter size.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 20, 17, 26, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krajsek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1028063212, 'comment_body': "Basically, what I want is to have `halo_size` be the maximum local size of the `v`. I initially assumed `v` to be balanced. > local filter size at process 1 to zero with redistribute_ So, yes this won't work,I'll change `halo_size` to be the maximum of all local chunk size. My method works with balanced tensor on process, so if the distribution is uneven, I pad the local chunk with 0 till halo_size is reached. Will change this :+1: ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 21, 13, 49, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1028498150, 'comment_body': 'If the maximum local size will work you can do: halo_size = torch.max(v.lshape_map[:, 0]).item() // 2', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 21, 20, 42, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krajsek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1028803422, 'comment_body': 'yes, done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 22, 3, 55, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1031197488, 'comment_body': 'Looks like `t_v` needs to be cast to float on GPU as well, GPU tests fail later at line 158 ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 24, 8, 44, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1031778467, 'comment_body': 'done, does it works now?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 24, 19, 2, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1042073227, 'comment_body': 'This seems to only partially solve the problem. It works for some configuration but for others it gives wrong results, for example on two processes: import heat as ht import torch signal = ht.ones((7,), split=0) weight = ht.ones((5,), split=0) target_map = torch.zeros((weight.comm.size, 1), dtype=torch.int) target_map[0, 0] = 4 target_map[1, 0] = 1 weight.redistribute_(target_map=target_map) print(ht.convolve(signal, weight)) leads to: DNDarray([1., 2., 3., 4., 5., 5., 5., 5., 5., 4., 3.], dtype=ht.float32, device=cpu:0, split=0) whereas the correct result must be: DNDarray([1., 2., 3., 4., 5., 5., 5., 4., 3., 2., 1.], dtype=ht.float32, device=cpu:0, split=0) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 12, 7, 11, 8, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krajsek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1043309509, 'comment_body': "yes, this convolve only supports weights which are balanced on all nodes, otherwise slicing method doesn't work due to more entries in `global_signal_filtered` as halo_size increased", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 12, 8, 12, 40, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1043463479, 'comment_body': 'I see, however these cases should be caught in any case, either by an error message or by rebalancing as getting wrong results are dangerous. i think there is a method called is_balanced (or similar) for checking if an array is balanced.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 12, 8, 15, 10, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krajsek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1043531355, 'comment_body': 'yes, even I think error message should be given. will do this asap.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 12, 8, 16, 5, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'shahpratham', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1062469318, 'comment_body': 'o.k., the code seems to be in a good shape now, from my side I would approve a PR. Nice work! ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 5, 13, 23, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krajsek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1085647155, 'comment_body': "Thanks @shahpratham , @krajsek , I'll approve and merge. Well done @shahpratham ! üëèüèº ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 17, 19, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ClaudiaComito', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
## Description

Implemented 2D convolution with distributed kernel support.

Issue resolved: #920
